Name: Dreams of Tomorrow: Awaken
Description: This mini expansion includes 8 new cards with four of them adding in no resonance to your dream sequences, but being worth a large number of points and four of them adding in resonance to all dream sequences but being worth very few points. They also add in four new abilities, including one that combines with other abilities!

Name: Moonshot: The Next Giant Leap
Description:
Build your rocket, get the funding and shoot for the Moon! But beware of the other space agency’s efforts and the risks during launch since only one team can win the race for the Moonlanding.

Moonshot: The Next Giant Leap is a team-based boardgame that encapsulates the thrill of the space race between the U.S. and the USSR with asymmetrical roles between team members.
The game pays tribute to the historical events, but it does not follow them strictly. Instead every game mechanism is inspired by the complex processes in the managerial and technical side of a space program.

Innovative gameplay solutions and a highly interactive setting let players experience their own unique story leading to the next giant leap of mankind.

—description from the publisher

Name: Civ Dice
Description:
Civ Dice is an interactive fast-playing Civilization style dice game for 2-4 players - playtime 30-60 minutes.

The object of the game is to train Armies, recruit Spies, elect Leaders, acquire Land, discover Technology, build Cities and Wonders - all with the goal of being the first to score 7 points.

In the game you select dice from a common pool together with your personal die, re-roll and/or manipulate the die face values and use them to pay for your builds, thereby growing your empire's abilities and scoring victory points.

—description from the designer

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Myths of the Arena
Description:
Myths of the Arena offers endless challenges for Heroes of any Soul rank, thanks to 4 different playing modes.

You can play Myths of the Arena as a co-op quest using the "Gods of the Arena" playing mode - a series of connected missions/challenges of increasing difficulty, ending in your fight with the Legends of the Arena, to win epic treasures.

But you can also use this expansion to enjoy using your Sword & Sorcery Heroes and Enemies using 3 bonus playing modes:

Lords of Endless Pain, where you find out how long can you hold your ground against an infinite horde of blood-thirsty enemies.
Kings of the Pit, where your challenge is to conquer the sacred altars and defend them.
Clash of the Heroes, where for the first time Heroes can fight against each other in duel - one vs. one, alone with a mercenary at youir side, or team vs. team.
This boxed-set expansion has a cost of $ 30 (future estimated MSRP $40) and it includes:

Nemean Lion, in two different versions - a red Enemy and a Master enemy;
Cerberus, the infernal creature from the world of Black Rose Wars, also  in two different versions - a red Enemy or a Master enemy;
15 new Cards - Events, Traps, Treasures.
12 new Map tiles to build the legendary Arena of Talon, in a "day" and "night" version, including the 4 corner "gladiators' pits," creating different setups for different challenges. The tiles are compatible with normal S&S tiles to create custom missions.
6 double-sided Trap overlays, to create 12 different lethal effects in the arena - whirling blades, fire pits, ice traps, sharp spears, and more!
Myths of the Arena can be played in the Ancient Chronicles campaign, but it is also completely compatible with Immortal Souls, and can be played in that campaign as well.

—description from the publisher

Name: Liniell
Description:
Liniell is an abstract tile placement game in which two players are building a 4 by 4 pattern of lines and rhombs.

Each turn the players have to draw a tile and place it next to the tiles already in play. Then they may place one of their two markers on this tile to occupy a line. Lines can only be occupied by one marker at a time and end only at rhombs or at the edge of the tiles.

The game ends when the player who placed the last tile finished their turn. Then, certain parts of the lines, the routes, are scored. Players score points according to the length of their routes, for routes enclosed by rhombs, and for blue rhombs on the ends of their routes.

—description from the designer

Name: Chesquerque
Description:
A chess variant played on a quadruple Alquerque board (9×9, similar to Dablo Aasele). Each player has 18 pieces — the usual chess pieces plus a ninth pawn and an archbishop, which moves as a combined bishop and knight.

The moves of the pieces are slightly adapted for the Alquerque grid: bishops and other diagonal-moving pieces can only move along grid lines; and knights are treated as moving two steps (one orthogonal, one diagonal) along grid lines and, like Chinese chess knights, cannot jump over an intervening piece.

As in chess, the object is to checkmate the opponent's king.

—user summary

Name: Garphill Games 5-Year Anniversary Promo Pack
Description:
A special set of web-exclusive promo packs for some of Garphill Games' releases from the past 5 years.

In this promo pack, you will find 30 never before seen promos for Shipwrights, Raiders and Architects, plus the long-awaited replacement cards of the Merchant and Trader for Raiders of the North Sea. The full contents are:

9 New Townsfolk Cards for Shipwrights
3 New Hero Cards for Raiders
4 Replacement Cards for Raiders
3 Byzantine Outsider Cards for Raiders
3 Saracen Outsider Cards for Raiders
5 New Apprentice Cards for Architects
3 New Viking Building Cards for Architects
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Jetpack Lhama
Description:
In the microgame Jetpack Lhama, players take the role of llamas who want to cross the ruins of an old city by use of jetpacks. But those ruins are cursed, and the llamas have to be careful. 
Players take turns laying out a track by flipping over cards one by one. Each card contains three symbols and can be placed overlapping the last card in order to reach a better score. Some symbols score points, some only in certain combinations. When the third curse is flipped open, the player loses all their points. When a player decides to stop, they note their score up to this point. First player to reach 50 points triggers the last round, the player with the highest score wins. 
While one player is laying out their track, the other players can bet on when the next curse symbol will appear. In this way, the other players can score some points outside their turn as well.

Name: Catan: Cities & Knights – Legend of the Conquerors
Description:
Catan: Die Legende der Eroberer ("The Legend of the Conquerors") contains three new scenarios for Catan, with these scenarios extending the gameplay in the Cities & Knights expansion (which is required for play) and linking together to tell one story.

Over three chapters, players experience another section of Catanian history. The additional game elements require deep strategic thinking and provide the most intense challenge players will have faced so far.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Just and Cruel War
Description:
Historical Background
In the early 1350, after the death of King Alfonso XI of Castile, the conflict between the reigning king Peter I and his illegitimate brother Henry of Trastamara put the Iberian peninsula in rage. This war became one part of a greater conflict involving the kingdoms of England and France, better known as the Hundred Years` War.

A Just and Cruel War shows how this bloody war was unleashed in the Iberian peninsula. The players will command the destinies of the royal side ("Petristas"), the usurper ("Trastamaras") and the crown of Aragon.

Game system
The game system (direct heir of the Fall of Hispania) is composed by a common deck of cards (where the historical events of the period are included), and another one specific for each player.

The players direct their armies over the mapboard, and they develop  intricated policies from this historical period, wich can favorise some of the factions that cohabited in the Castilian Kingdom (nobles, Jews, Military Orders...).

—description from the designer

Name: Dungeon Cruller
Description:
Dungeon delvers, deep down, demand delicious doughnuts! Build a successful underground catering business to feed the hungry hordes descending into the depths before they loot the place and never return. Can you build your retirement nest egg before the doughnut demand dries up?

Dungeon Cruller is a solitaire game of selling doughnuts to fantastic dungeon delvers and denizens. You win by investing enough extra cash into the lucrative dungeon treasure market before the doughnut business collapses. Purchase doughnuts, deliver them to shops, and upgrade the business to thrive. Low-risk strategies pay reliably, but will that be enough before time runs out? Or should you spend it all on high-risk, high-reward payoffs? A game of risk and gambling, you'll need to sort the good bets from the bad to keep one step ahead. Are you clever enough to overcome the luck of the dice?

Designed as part of the 2018 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

—description from the designer

Name: Shieldbearer
Description:
“Rules for ancient combat simulation.”
This is a rule set for miniatures battles at an army scale. Units are comprised of 2 - 12 Elements with each element being upwards of 200 men or horses, single elephants, or 20 or so chariots.
It includes a points system for balancing armies and terrain, and for calculating victory.  
Movement and ranges are calculated as multiples of element base size.
The rules are simple and straightforward with consideration given to different arms and armour in combat as well as ‘Determination’(which is factored from morale), organization, and depth of ranks.

The main distinguishing characteristic of these rules is perhaps the necessity to Order each unit, the considerations for changing orders, and the fact that troops under attack orders must move forward. Thus initial Orders, especially,(which may include ‘if’,’until’,’and then’ clauses) are very important.

—user summary

Name: Thumb Chess
Description:
Thumb Chess is played on a specifically designed small-sized board with spots along the perimeter of the top for your thumbs to rest during play. High strategy in a small package you can play anywhere.  You just need the Thumb Chess board and four thumbs.

On a player's turn they move one of their thumbs to a new space following chess-inspired movement rules.  The spots all have a chess piece associated with them.  Your left thumb moves according to the rules of the piece associated with your right thumb's position, and vice versa.

The goal is to get your thumbs to Checkmate an opponent's thumb by getting your thumbs into both spots surrounding it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mexican Checkers: Ayatix
Description:
The players will try to gather their harvest grains, placing in the squares on the board, the chips of their corresponding colors, and 3 black chips at the intersections of the lines that make up the board, the movements will be given by jumping the chips, both its color as blacks, until getting to make a path that takes that fruit to its place of origin, moving them around the board that simulates the Ayate, which is an ancient pre-Hispanic tool that served as a deposit of fruits, and in which it is found the virgin of Guadalupe is depicted, and once a player manages to take one of his fruits to the color that corresponds to him, he will be able to enter a huitlacoche, that is, a black chip of the 5 that he will have in his possession, and that will remain in his external side, will win who manages to gather all its fruits on its side, and also has managed to put the rest of their black chips into the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Crussato
Description:
Crussato is a game played on the standard 8x8 chessboard.  It is designed to be a very simple to learn, yet highly strategical, board game. Its minimal and simple ruleset allows new players of all ages to rapidly engage in action, while reserving great challenges for the chessboard veterans.

It is a 2 player game and each player gets sixteen pieces.  Fourteen pieces (two sets of 7) marked with a number between 1 ~ 7 and and two pieces marked with an X.  The X marked pieces are called the Dukes.  All pieces are free to move in Queen style movements.  Their imprinted numbers define their step limitations.  Dukes also move freely, but only one step at a time.  The goal of the game is for each player to eliminate both opponent Dukes.

The game is played on the above three simple rules, plus one optional rule for advanced players. This optional rule limits the movement of a piece, after it crosses the middle line, and requires it to stay at the opponent side of the board until the end of the game. Draw cases are possible and described in the games ruleset.

—description from the designer

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Venom
Description:
Expand your Legendary experience with all-new poisoned and venomized versions of your favorite heroes and villains! Help Venom and Carnage devour their way through the Marvel Universe, on a collision course with new epic masterminds like Poison Thanos!

The Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Venom expansion features five new heroes, two new villain groups, two new masterminds, and four new schemes. The return of fan-favorite keywords like Excessive Violence, as well as some all new game mechanisms and new twists on some old ones! Watch out when a Symbiote villain ambushes the city as they might bond with another villain to create a powerful adversary!

—description from the publisher

Name: Big City: 20th Anniversary Jumbo Edition – Urban Upgrade
Description:
Expansion for the Jumbo edition (not compatible with the original edition) which includes:

15 more large building Miniatures including 4 brand new building types never before released (Police Station, Hospital, Parking Garage, School)

2 additional Modular Neighborhood Boards (Neighborhood 9 and 0)

New Waterfront Tile (Brand New - never before released!)

Additional player markers to add a 5th player (Scoring Marker/ +100 Marker).

18 Property Cards

Rules Sheet

Name: Z War One: Exodus – Dark Tide
Description:
The Kickstarter edition of Exodus comes complete with the intense & emotionally charged Dark Tide expansion.

Experience the terror of the initial outbreak from the perspective of two desperate parents, fighting to get their daughter to safety. This prequel campaign introduces new characters, locations & monsters to the Exodus roster.

Dark Tide also includes the 2-4 player "Renegade Mode". Work individually or as a team to collect as many loot cards as possible, use director cards to hinder your opponent's progress. If you are taken down, continue your fight from beyond the grave, using your freshly infected hero to tear apart the opposition.

Name: Z War One: Exodus – All Star Roamers
Description: They say variety is the spice of death and never has this been truer than in the case of the "all star roamers". This motley bunch are an optional feature for Exodus players wishing to bring a little more personality to the undead masses. Pulled from a finite spawn deck, the all stars each have personal traits & stat cards making roamer encounters much more unpredictable and  potentially deadly!

Name: Z War One: Exodus – Infected Heroes
Description: In director & quick play games, any fallen heroes immediately jump back into the game as a "newborn" fast zombie.

Name: Z War One: Exodus – Delta 6 Aftermath
Description: Hero & infected cards for using Exodus miniatures in Damnation games. A special campaign "Delta 6 - Aftermath" using assets from all existing Z War One content + 3 additional game tiles.

Name: Z War One: Damnation – Delta 6 Expansion
Description: The frozen north of the UK is a safe haven during the winter months, the undead firmly frozen in their tracks. Refugees and military alike sit behind the relative (if a bit chilly) safety of the wall. One group of elite soldiers are not so lucky...

Name: Z War One: Damnation – Infected Heroes
Description: In campaign games, the death of a hero ends their mission. In director games however, any fallen heroes immediately jump back into the game as a 'newborn' fast zombie & join the forces of the evil director.

Name: Super Bunny Wars
Description:
Fight for victory in a super awesome draft-battle game. Mix and match cards from seven different factions to combine the perfect team of legendary, epic and common bunnies. Create powerful combos, go on the defensive, or just fight with raw attack power. 
But beware.... There are many plot twist cards to mess op your plans.

Knock-out your opponent(s) bunnies in a strategic battle to score victory points. Scoring the most victory points over a 2 round battle will make you the winner of a game of Super Bunny Wars

Super Bunny Wars is an ode to the late 80’s, early 90’s cartoons we loved as kids. Made into a Draft-Battle game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Saca la Lengua
Description:
Saca la Lengua / Treu la Llengua ("Stick out your tongue") is a game on the oral microbiome created together with the Center for Genome Regulation (CRG, Barcelona) for its citizen science project "Saca la Lengua". The game idea was designed in cocreation sessions with scientists, journalists, teachers, and various citizens. Then it was developed by the authors in collaboration with the science communication team in the CRG.

Saca la Lengua / Treu la Llengua is a cooperative game in which players represent members of the general population with certain characteristics of their microbiome (represented in game by 8 genera of bacteria, whose population is represented by the value of 8 dice). The goal is to keep the oral microbiome of the players as close as possible as the ideal equilibrium values (obtained in real life thanks to the research project).

During 5 rounds, the players do the following actions:
a) Each player with 2 or more genera in equilibrium draws an action card, with which he/she can improve the microbiome of other players.
b) Each player draws a "Life is tough" card and applies its effects on himself. Then a common "Life is tough" card is drawn and it must be applied to one of the players (cooperatively chosen).

Some cards add some additional "infection" dice or "severe condition" markers. When the players exceed a certain threshold of infection dice or severe condition markers, they lose the game. Otherwise, if they reach the end of the 5th round, they won and calculate points to know the degree of equilibrium of their oral microbiota.

—description from the designer

Name: Black Cat
Description:
Black Cat: Dice Game For Adults

Object: To beat the Black Cat

Bet: Beverage of choice or Halloween candy

Roll dice to determine who is the Black Cat.

The Black Cat rolls 2 dice from the cup (without showing the results.)

Each player rolls 1 die.

The player bets his number to be either between Black Cat's 2 dice
or outside.

If the bet is correct, player wins.
If equal to either of Black Cat's 2 dice, player gets a "push."

When Black Cat loses, player to the right is the new Black Cat.

Name: All Manor of Evil: Madness Stirs
Description:
The contents of Madness Stirs is comprised of stretch goals unlocked throughout the Kickstarter campaign.
This expansion will contain more complex monsters, relics, roles, and other content not available in the retail version of the game.

Name: Fantazja
Description:
Fantasy - a fairy-tale land - was ruined. It can be rebuilt only by the powerful Natural Sculptors or Light Engineers who call for the existence of things using the power of their imagination.

During play, you will play their roles and recreate the destroyed kingdom - starting with its capital. A person who will show a greater fantasy will receive the wealth and hand of a beautiful princess ... or prince.

So let's do it! Let your imagination run wild and rebuild Fantasy. Think carefully about the choice of buildings because the tiles that you place on the table around the Magic Castle will provide you with extra powers during the game, and at the end of the game, Victory Points. Whoever gets more of them will win.

Name: Pic! Six!!
Description:
Pic! Six!! is a football board/card game for 2 or 4 players. Play centers around action at the Line of Scrimmage. Each turn is a “Down”. Each player plays a combination of cards trying to win the “Down” The results are a combination of charts and dice. One player uses their “Offense” cards & the other uses their “Defense” cards. 
Each player has two “Audible” cards, so they are able to change their play during the “Down”.
A sand timer is used to keep the game moving along.
There is a set of “Special Teams” cards which the players share when needed.
The first player/team to score 10 points wins. 
The whole idea is to have a fast-paced game.

“Fast-playing light simulation of a 2-Minute Drill” The perfect description by tempus42

—description from the designer

Name: Vs System 2PCG: The Buffy Battles
Description:
Vs System 2PCG: The Buffy Battles is an expansion for the Vs System 2PCG game system but is a stand alone game.

The Buffy Battles will feature 200 cards with images taken from the show, split between "The Good Scoobies" and the "Evil Forces of Darkness," the two teams in the game.

The Good Scoobies are naturally led by the Slayer herself, Buffy, whose "Slayer" ability allows her to kill Evil supporting characters regardless of how much health or vitality they have.  Her team includes characters like Giles, Xander, Cordella, and Willow.

The Evil Forces of Darkness, on the other hand, is composed mostly of vampires like Drusilla and The Master, who can gain vitality by wounding opposing characters.  Other villains, including the demonic Mayor Wilkins and the voice-stealing Gentlemen also put in an appearance.

The set also includes some characters that can join either side, or even change sides during the game, including Buffy’s love interest Angel, who can become the evil Angelus, and the evil Slayer Faith.

Contents:
200 Playable Cards
1 Token Sheet
1 Rulebook
Families: TV Shows: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

Name: Mystic Vale Event Kit: Havens
Description:
Havens stand as isolated points of light gleaming in the growing darkness. The druids of the Mystic Vale rely on these bastions as secure way-points, sites where they can rest and recover, and strongholds from which they can sally forth to battle the ever-growing corruption. Were these havens to fall, it would make the druids' crusade that much harder.

Mystic Vale Event Kit: Havens contains new Havens cards that gain new powers and abilities as you use them across multiple games! Watch them grow and change as the different advancements you use over several games change. These new cards and their mechanics, are only available as part of the event kit.

—description from the publisher

The kit includes: 40 Havens cards, 8 Gaia's Sanctuary, 320 card sleeves (8 unique sets of 40 tarot-sized custom sleeves), 8 sets of 3 promo advancements, 8 sets of 3 promo vales, and a rulebook.

Name: Krowdfunder: The Game
Description:
Welcome to Krowdfunder – the crowdfunded game about crowdfunding. In this game, players try to successfully fund as many projects as possible through a simple mechanic that recreates the rollercoaster experience of running crowdfunding campaigns.

Basically, you are creating a campaign for a project and are trying to make it as successful as possible, maximizing the two key factors of any crowdfunding campaign: the number of backers and the pledge that each backer is going to make.

At the setup of the game, players are given a starting hand of campaign cards, a draw pile is made with the remaining cards. A selection of audience cards are placed in the centre of the table for the players to see, which are flipped before the game starts so players have to try and remember where the best of these cards are.

Players take turns to draw a card from a central draw pile; there are five different suits of cards that players are trying to collect to generate enough money to meet their funding goal. The suits are: pledges, stretch goals, add-ons, videos and buzz! Each campaign card depending on its type will provide the player with either coins or backers, multiplying the number of each together gives the player their funding total.

Mixed with these campaign cards there are also special action cards that allow players to interact with other players and the game further to help them get the cards they need.

Once a player has collected a set of the required cards, they are able to launch their project, declaring this to the other players as everyone tries to grab an audience card from the centre of the table to help them meet their goal.

Once a player has successfully funded projects worth 40 coins, they are declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Breakout: First Panzer Army
Description:
Breakout: 1st Panzer Army allows one or two players to examine the operational possibilities inherent in the battle between the Soviets and Germans that occurred in the northwest Ukraine during March and April 1944.

Each full turn represents three days. Each hex on the map represents 4.2 miles (6.8 km) from side to opposite side.

Designer: Ty Bomba.  Developer: Antony Birkett.

Name: Crime Wave
Description:
Summary 
A fast paced easy to learn game that is fun for the whole family. Be the first to collect five diamonds and prove that you are the ultimate criminal. Each player has a limited amount of time to build a criminal empire and build up their cash reserves so that they can out bid their opponents for the coveted diamonds. 
Each player will take on the role of Kingpin, Fence, Pickpocket, and Corrupt Politician to prove that they the are the best at being bad.

Game play 
As soon as the dealer is ready, they start the timer. They do not have to wait for the rest of the players to be ready. As soon as the timer is started the dealer begins drawing cards one at a time from the Crime Card deck and either giving it to the player to their left or adding it to their hand and giving the player to their left a card from their hand. This continues with cards being passed around the circle this way until time runs out. 
Once time runs out, starting with the dealer each player takes a turn biding for one of the diamonds. One at a time each player states the value of their bid and places the cards that they are using for their bid face down in front of them. Each bid must consist of only one type of Crime Card. You cannot have a mix of cards with different values. Once all the players have bid, the player with the highest remaining bid wins and takes a diamond from the middle pile. The first player to accumulate five diamonds wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: France '40: Victory or Defeat
Description:
France 1940: Victory or Defeat, allows one or two players to examine the strategic possibilities inherent in the campaign that occurred within France and the Low Countries in that year. A second scenario allows for an alternative history examination of the opportunity the French had in September 1939 if they’d kept their promise to launch a “major offensive” into Germany within a week after that nation invaded Poland. All the orders of battle are entirely historical in both scenarios. The main body of rules is written with the 1940 scenario in mind. All changes required for the play of the 1939 scenario are identified as such in each specific case.

Each full game turn of the 1940 scenario represents 3.5 days. In the 1939 scenario each turn represents two days. Each hex on the map represents 16 miles (26 km) from side to opposite side.

World at War Magazine #68

Name: Burning Suns: Parallel Galaxies
Description:
32 new systems, 10 new factions, and more miscellaneous tokens for Burning Suns. The "new" factions are duplicates of the originals with different names and associated art, allowing two players to have the "same" core race. For example, the Terrans and Terran Marauders have the same Race profiles (same ship stats, same number of technology slots and ship upgrade slots). The ideology and framework tiles are exact duplicates.

It's another set of 18 punchboard sheets just like in the core game.

—user summary

Name: The Immortal Wars
Description:
The Universal Tabletop Strategy Game of Gods, Monsters, and Machines

From the mountains of Olympus to the depths of the darkest oceans, they awoke from their long slumber. Gods, demi-gods, titans, demons and other-worldly beings from your nightmares came from myth and became reality. Alliances formed and the stage was set for war like never before seen on Earth, or even beneath it.

Mankind has found itself between colossal forces of legendary power. C’thulean terrors rise from the oceans as gods ride winged beasts into battle. Meanwhile, the armies of humanity fight simply to survive. With the awakening of the gods, long dormant demi-gods, mutants, and freaks, have unleashed chaos on the world.

This new world disorder has left many cities burning husks while the people flee to the remaining bastions of safety and security.

The Immortal Wars is a table-top strategy game mixing fantasy, modern, science-fiction, and superhero genres. Do battle with tanks, infantry, hovercraft, jet fighters, giant mecha, mutants, superhumans, and abominations.

—description from the rulebook

The Immortal Wars is played on a flat surface (a minimum of 4' x 6' is recommended) with distances measured in inches (the game uses the curiously mixed ratio of 1 inch to 7.5 meters).  Combatants are represented by miniature figures (representing single units) with an associated "unit card" providing data and tracking damage, etc.  Combat and movement occur in rounds, each round representing about six seconds.  Random results are generated using only twelve-sided dice (d12).  Several dice in different colors are recommended.

The game assumes two "sides" in each combat, each controlled by one (optionally more) player.  Each player builds their force by purchasing units with points.  One player is the defender; the other player is the attacker.  Setup follows a pre-determined "scenario" (setup guide).

During each round, initiative is determined.  The losing player moves 1/2 of their units; the winning player moves 1/2 of their units; the losing player move the remainder of their units; the winning player moves the remainder of their units.  Most units can move vertically as well as horizontally.  Units utilize a somewhat simplified method of two-dimensional facing.  Attacks are resolved at the end of a movement, if legal - this means the player that loses initiative will perform the first attacks of the round.

The game supports a wide range of combatant types, from mecha to armor to monsters.  Many units have special abilities that invoke special rules.  A variety of terrain and status situations may apply.  The game also provides a wide variety of optional rules (including adjustments to 25mm scale).

Play persists until one player achieves pre-determined victory results or eliminates the other player.

The game document includes a large number of print-and-play tokens to mark various effects on the battlefield.  Also included are blank, print-and-play unit cards.

—user summary

Name: The Immortal Wars: Humans
Description:
A Faction List for tabletop warfare in the age of gods, monsters, and technology!

In a desperate bid for survival, humans turned to technology to save them from the ever-growing threats of the Immortals and Beasts.

[This print-and-play component] is a list of official units available for The Immortal Wars. While official, it is incomplete. We highly encourage you to modify units and create new units and share them. If you choose to make alternate versions of these units and share them in your own document, we ask that you change the names on the stat cards for clarity.

—description from the rulebook

Name: The Immortal Wars: Thuleans
Description:
A Faction List for tabletop warfare in the age of gods, monsters, and technology!

Twisted forms in the deepest dark of the oceans rose to reclaim the lands.

[This print-and-play component] is a list of official units available for The Immortal Wars. While official, it is incomplete. We highly encourage you to modify units and create new units and share them. If you choose to make alternate versions of these units and share them in your own document, we ask that you change the names on the stat cards for clarity.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Tandem
Description: The game is based on cards. On each card 8 words are written. You have to associate 2 words from 2 different cards to make an expression. For example if glass is one of the words on the first card and wine is one of the words on the second card you could say "a glass of wine". All the players are playing simultanously, trying to be the first to find a valid expression.

Name: Hero Realms: The Lost Village Campaign Deck
Description: The Lost Village continues the adventure where The Ruin of Thandar left off. It features  a full-color Adventure Book, and contains over 100 cards, including 12 oversized Master cards.

Name: Hero Realms: Journeys – Hunters
Description: The 12-card Hunters packs each feature new Champions and Actions for your market deck.

Name: Hero Realms: Ancestry
Description: The 20-card Ancestry pack allows you to play Hero Realms as a Dwarf, Elf, Ogre, Orc, or Smallfolk. You may use any race with a generic starting deck, or combine them with any character pack. So you could play as an ogre wizard, an elven ranger, a dwarven fighter, or any one of the 30 new race/class combinations.

Name: Hero Realms: Journeys – Travelers
Description: The 12-card Travelers pack feature new Champions and Actions for your market deck.

Name: Hero Realms: Journeys – Conquest
Description: The Conquest pack contain 6 new quest cards and 6 new relic cards. You will get secret quests at the start of the game, each giving you a special objective. When you complete a quest, you immediately acquire a powerful relic as your reward.

Name: Hero Realms: Journeys – Discovery
Description: The Discovery pack contain 6 new quest cards and 6 new relic cards. You will get secret quests at the start of the game, each giving you a special objective. When you complete a quest, you immediately acquire a powerful relic as your reward.

Name: Luna: Metal Coins
Description:
The new content includes 93 Metal Moon Coins, Wooden Priestess Figure, 4 Oversized Wooden Preacher Novice Meeples, and 1 embroidered drawstring bag.

Featuring new game play rules:

The new priestess figure moves around within the temple itself, giving bonuses to adjacent novices at the end of each round.

The larger novice "preacher" figures give players extra strength on the islands.

Name: Among the Stars: Lost and Found Promo Card
Description:
Part of Artipia's A Fair, a Robbery and a Promo Pack Kickstarter Campaign.

A new location card.

Choose up to 3 cards from the discard pile and set them aside. Once per game, you may swap a card in your hand with one of the set aside cards.

Name: Badass Riders: Four Horsemen
Description:
Four Horsemen expands the Badass Riders experience with two new game modes:

     Cooperative Mode: Battle against the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse and their fearsome war machines in three deadly challenges.
     League Mode: Place bets and collude with other drivers, upgrade and repair your vehicles, and manage your gas to win the Fuel Wasteland League.

Name: Raumaneuvos kaupunkipeli
Description: Raumaneuvos is a local reimplementation of Monopoly for the city of Rauma, Finland. It has some new rules and the stops are all local landmarks and businesses. 1200 copies of the game have been made.

Name: Newton: Robert Hooke Promo Card
Description:
Robert Hooke is new Master card, given as a promocard at GenCon 2018 and Spiel 2018.
This promo is already included in the New Edition of Newton.


He doesn't give any instant power but he gives 9 victory points at the end of the game.

Name: Newton: Stephen Hawking Promo Card
Description:
Stephen Hawking is new Master card, given as a promo card at Spiel 2018.
This promo is already included in the New Edition of Newton.


He has an instant effect: move an already placed book tile in the library to another book space without needing to satisfy the new book place request.

He gives 7 victory points at the end of the game.

Name: Life Coach
Description: A party game where you find answers to life's big and small questions. One player presents a problem and the other players choose the best answer from cards in their hands.

Name: Gingerbread House: Spiel 2018 Promo Cards
Description:
Set of 9 cards that were given for free at Spiel 2018 if you bought the game from Lookout Games.

It contains 6 new characters (Vampire, Gingerbread Man, Woodcutter, Game Illustrator, Game Designer & Sea Troll) and 3 new bonus cards (Enchanted Mirror, Raven & Pentacle).

You just shuffle the new cards with the corresponding base game cards.

Name: Namn Memo
Description: Namn Memo is a memory game with a twist. All tiles have a name on them, and among the tiles there is a tile with the same name spelled backwards. If a player flip two tiles with the same name, the player keep those cards. The player with most points in the end is the winner.

Name: With Sword and Bayonet
Description:
A set of Colonial-era skirmish rules for miniatures wargaming. Each figure represents an individual. The rules are suitable for use with 54mm or 25mm figures, using respective scales of 1"=1m or 1cm=1m. The rules system uses percentile dice. Editions were reportedly published by Active Service Press and Tabletop Games. Self-published as a 30 page typewritten rule booklet with text on only one side of the pages and an included reference card.

—user summary

Name: Cave Pilot 55: Acid Test Expansion
Description:
Adds the following additional cards:
4 cave cards 
2 exploration cards 
1 small beast card 
1 large beast card

These can be substituted for base game cards or added to them, providing more variation to the game.

Name: Sound Out: A Game For All Talks Of Life
Description:
Sound Out is the first tabletop game of sound spelling! Each card represents a sound made by the mouth. Instead of combining letters to spell words players combine sounds to pronounce them!

Sound Out is compact with 5 gameplay options.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spank the Yeti: Geek Pack
Description: Official expansion to Spank the Yeti. Includes 100 cards featuring favorite geeky references plus ten blank cards.

Name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone: Diagon Alley Chapter Game
Description:
This is a game in the Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone Chapter Game series, in which games are contained in a portable box designed to look like a book, and the theme of the game corresponds to chapters in the book Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.

In this roll-and-move game, you are trying to collect all six tokens before your opponent.

On your turn, you roll two dice. One die determines how many spaces you can move, and the other die determines how many spaces you must move the Malfoy figure. To win the game you must first collect the Gringotts Token, then you must collect each of the other five tokens by visiting the various stores on the map. If you land on a space with Malfoy, or he lands on the space where you are standing, you lose the token you most recently acquired. The first player to collect all six tokens and return to the "Leaky Cauldron" spot wins.

Name: Elemental Towers
Description:
A Components: Looney Pyramid Games solitaire game

You will need 45 Looney Pyramids - 3 trios each of 5 colors (Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Black) and an Aquarius deck (Any edition. The game was designed using a 1st edition deck, and the rules include a note about which cards to remove if you are using a newer edition.)

The trumpets have sounded, the fires are lit, and the Elemental Tribes are heading to the celebration! You have thirty days to harness the power of the elements to build towering crystal shrines as tributes. Can you impress the chieftains? The strongest Tribes award the most prestige, so make haste to complete your Elemental Towers!

The object of the game is to score points by building towers of pyramids. Towers that are the color of the most highly valued elements at the end of the game will score the most points. As you play cards to the table, placing matching elements side by side will allow you to build pyramids and move them from space to space to form towers. Try to achieve the highest score you can before the deck runs out!

—description from the designer

Name: Welcome To...: Winter Wonderland Thematic Neighborhood
Description:
Thematic Neighborhood Sheet Packs serve as refill and expansion packs for the base game. They are more than just some pretty decorations for the neighborhood. These packs come with new ways to score as well! Each pack comes with 3 associated city plan cards.

In Winter Wonderland rules remain similar to the original, but now every house that you build in numerical order will have lights strung between them and contribute to scoring points at the end of the game. Everyone's longest string of lights on each street will score them points!

Name: Welcome To...: Doomsday Thematic Neighborhood
Description:
Thematic Neighborhood Sheet Packs serve as refill packs for the base game. They are more than just some pretty decorations for the neighborhood. These packs come with new ways to score as well! Each pack comes with 3 associated city plan cards.

Welcome To... Doomsday
Players are trying to save as many people as possible from impending nuclear destruction! When you build a house with a bunker you also save people equal to the house number! At the end of the game the person who saved the most people on each street will score bonus points!

Name: Welcome To...: Outbreak Thematic Neighborhood
Description:
Thematic Neighborhood Sheet Packs serve as refill packs for the base game. They are more than just some pretty decorations for the neighborhood. These packs come with new ways to score as well! Each pack comes with 3 associated city plan cards.

Welcome To... Outbreak! 
You're going to have to protect the Neighborhood from a zombie invasion while building your community. Build barricades and collect ammo to fend off the zombies. Will you be able to survive the zombie horde?

Name: Welcome To...: Halloween Thematic Neighborhood
Description:
Thematic Neighborhood Sheet Packs serve as refill packs for the base game. They are more than just some pretty decorations for the neighborhood. These packs come with new ways to score as well! Each pack comes with 3 associated city plan cards.

WELCOME TO... HALLOWEEN!
In this spooky neighborhood when players build houses they get to choose a trick or a treat, circling either a ghost or a candy. The first player to reach a certain amount of ghosts or candies can declare it to use the bonus. Once used, it's no longer available to other players; who will then cross the bonus off. Only 1 ghost and 1 candy bonus per player!

Name: Bagan Journey
Description:
Explore the city of Bagan, ancient home of Myanmar kings. Players collect memories, curios, items, and vehicles as they discover the region’s vivid history and culture, and the player with the most discoveries at the end of the game is the winner.

On their turn, player roll the dice, and move on the board in the direction they choose. They explore the location they land on. Some give Discovery Points (DP) and advance you towards victory. Some allow you to draw cards. There are different types of cards: Events to be resolved immediately, vehicles to equip, souvenirs and experiences, or tricks for the other players! Some can be kept in hand, some are played immediately, and others played when you want to.

The 10 main temples of Bagan are represented on the board. They are a good source of DP. You came to Bagn to visit temples after all! The first player to land on one gets 5 points and the "temple card" that features interesting facts about the building. If another player lands on the same temple, he only gets 3DP (there's more tourists on the site!) but gets the card from the previous player. Some effects in the game reward the player with the most temples cards.

But there's other ways to rack in many points, such as getting a hot air balloon ticket for the trip of a lifetime and getting on the location with luck or cards! (10 DP!). Or mounting an elephant and wearing the traditional Tanaka and visiting villages and markets are all locals will cheer with you! (3DP per visit)

The game ends when one player reach 30 DP (50DP in the Advanced rules)

Recommend to anyone: Who wouldn’t want to play a game about going on holiday?

Name: Warhammer Quest: Domain of the Horned Rat
Description:
This is expansion came withWhite Dwarf issue 195. It consists of three new event cards, a new dungeon tile (with associated card), three adventures using this tile, 6 warpstone counters, new special rules for various different Skaven enemies and rules for including Skaven in the roleplay rules.

The rumours are that there was originally planned to be a third boxed expansion for Warhammer Quest, focusing on Skaven in much the same way that the previous two expansions had focused on greenskins and the undead. This is what made it into the public domain after a change of plan by Games Workshop.

—user summary

Name: Sta panigiria tou bizantiou
Description:
The game is set in Thessaloniki at the end of the 13th Century until the beginning of the 14th century. We witness one of the most grand flee markets of the Byzantine Empire, the "Dimitria". The grand flee markets of the time had significant value, similar to today's exhibitions. Such markets consisted of tradesman, bankers, musicians, actors and magicians. Nicolo Beltram a great tradesman from Genova, has to visit a banker to convert some byzantine coins (that slowly lose their value) to Genevese coins.

The game board consists of 2 round circuits on which players move based on dice rolls. Except for moving along the board, picking up power or money cards, players can interact with merchants placed along the board, as well as interact with other players but only when both players end up on the same tile. Each player then rolls a die and multiplies it with each current power status and the one with the least takes damage on his/her power status.

As the goal of the game players by selling and buying products to gain the most power and money.

Name: De Slimste Mens Ter Wereld Junior
Description:
Now you can play the Junior edition of The Smartest Person in the World!

The Junior edition of The Smartest Person in the World includes 5 rounds of questions specially devised for younger players aged 8 and upwards.
Get your opponent down to 0 seconds and take the crown of the youngest Smartest Person in the World!

The game can be played with the whole family in combination with the basic game.

-description from publisher

Name: Oh, Wat Een Jaar!: het bordspel
Description:
PLAY THE BOARD GAME VERSION OF THE TELEVISION PROGRAM ‘A YEAR TO REMEMBER!' FAMOUS FROM DUTCH TELEVISION!

Divide the players into two teams and go back to the year …?! Answer questions about that year and spot errors in famous lyrics. Who appeared in the news? And how much are you able to remember from that year? Earn the most points with your team and win!

Name: Downlink: The Game of Planetary Discovery
Description:
In Downlink, players lead a space agency to develop missions of planetary exploration. Resources are limited, and players must constantly decide where to allocate them best to score the most points. They can choose to specialize in launching rockets, delivering spacecraft to targets, downlinking science data, or spread their resources across multiple areas to increase the likelihood of success. Key events require dice rolling, and team training is available to stack the odds in player's favor.

The game ends when a player reaches 30 or more points on their turn or if there are no cards left for a player to restore their hand to six cards. When one of these events happen, each player gets one last turn. The game can be lengthened or shortened by adjusting the number of points needed to win.

After each player completes their last turn, they total up the number of points scored. The player with the highest total number of points wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the highest Discovery points wins.

-description from designer

Name: Beatrix: Mr. McGregor's Garden
Description:
A 3-5 player trick taking game designed for small children.

In this game, players receive 3 cards, choose one to keep, one to pass to the player on their left, one to pass to the player on their right, then draw a card. Cards are numbered 1-35. Players only work through this small deck once, receiving a total of 6-8 cards. After the trick taking phase, end game scoring is resolved based on the various vegetables collected from Mr. McGregor's garden.

Players receive a unique character which effects scoring opportunities. Among these, Mr. McGregor, who wants to collect one of each vegetable in his garden and cause the animals to lose their collections of vegetables; Peter Rabbit who prefers carrots and attempts to retrieve his coat from Mr. McGregor's scarecrow; Benjamin Bunny who is likewise attempting to retrieve Peter's coat but prefers onions; Flopsy, Mopsy and Cottontail, (played by 1 player) who try to collect 3 vegetables of any kind; and Timmy Willie and Johnny Townmouse (played by one player), who can trade vegetables with other players and want to lose all of their vegetables to Mr. McGregor. This exciting and chaotic romp through Mr. McGregor's garden also features other original characters created by Beatrix Potter, including Squirrel Nutkin and Old Brown, Mrs. Tiggywinkle, and Jeremy Fisher.

The game also includes a variant for amall children, and a simple 2 player variant.

To play the game, you will need a means to keep score.

-description from designer

Name: Das Supertalent
Description:
The game is based on the RTL game Show "Das Supertalent". The players roll an eight-sided die. According to the result of the roll, the players draw a task card from category 1, 2, 3 or 4 and have to resolve the task, described on the card. The categories are:

1 Table Star
2 Acrobat
3 Superhirn (Mastermind)
4 Showtalent

If a task is solved, points are rewarded. On a fixed amount of points the players move their meeples one step ahead. If a player reaches the space "Ziel" he has to solve a last task to win the game.

Name: Pillow Fight Card Game
Description: Players simultaneously search for matching pairs of pillows, then throw those pillows at their opponents. When all the pillows are gone, the player with the fewest cards wins!

Name: Linear Pursuit
Description:
LINEAR PURSUIT

Manœuvre your pieces around the board, capturing and blocking your opponents pieces.
Capture your opponents ‘King’ to win the game.

SET UP
There are two sets of positions, an inner ‘in play’ set on the circumference of the playing area, and directly behind these, an outer ‘out of play’ set.
There are many, many set up options.
Less pieces for a potentially shorter game (‘major pieces’ may not necessarily be the same for each player), provided each player begins with the same number of pieces and both must have a ‘King’.

Players may agree a symmetrical set up, or, they may elect to take alternate turns randomly placing their pieces (not necessarily on their own side of the board).
Players may elect to play with, or without ‘Pawns” in the ‘inner’ (in play) positions.

‘CLASSIC’
‘Major pieces’ (King, Bishops, Knights and Rooks) always begin play in the outer (out of play) positions. Each ‘major piece’, starts with a ‘Pawn’ in it’s inner (in play) position.
“Classic’ set up requires all pieces.
Centrally, on the players own side of the board, place the ‘King’, flanked by ‘Bishops’, ‘Knights’ and finally ‘Rooks’.
A ‘Pawn’ should be placed in each ‘major piece’s’ ‘inner’ (in play) position.

RULES OF MOVEMENT
A piece can only move around the board from the ‘inner’ (in play) positions.
A piece in an ‘outer’ (out of play) position, must first be placed in it’s inner (in play) position, if vacant, this constitutes a players turn. If a major piece in it’s ‘outer’ (out of play) position has an occupied ‘inner’ (in play) position, the major piece is effectively blocked and cannot move.
’In play’ pieces move as follows:

PAWN
May only move from it’s position, along a single line, to a new position.
No use of the circumference is permitted.
If the target position is occupied by another of the player’s own pieces, that move is unavailable.
If the target position is occupied by an opponents ‘Pawn’, that piece is deemed ‘captured’ and removed from the board. 
If the target position is occupied by an opponent’s ‘major’ piece (‘Rook’, ‘Knight’, ‘Bishop’ or ‘King’), that move is unavailable (a ‘Pawn’ cannot capture a ‘major’ piece.

ROOK
As ‘Pawn’, however, may capture ‘major’ pieces.

KNIGHT
Once ‘in play’, can only move from it’s position along two
consecutive lines, connected by a vacant ‘inner’ (in play) position. If the target position is occupied by another of the player’s own pieces, that move is unavailable.
If the target position is occupied by an opponent’s piece, that piece is deemed ‘captured’ and removed from the board.
The two lines used, must be a combination of the circumference and an inner line, in no particular order.

BISHOP
Once ‘in play’, can only move from it’s position along two consecutive lines, connected by a vacant ‘inner’ (in play) position. No use of the circumference is permitted.
If the target position is occupied by another of the player’s own pieces, that move is unavailable.
If the target position is occupied by an opponent’s piece, that piece is deemed ‘captured’ and removed from the board.

KING
Once ‘in play’, may elect to move either along a single line (as Pawn/Rook), or, along two consecutive lines
(as Bishop).

VICTORY
Victory is achieved either by capturing your opponent’s ‘King’, or, if your opponent has no legal move available.

(If only the two ‘Kings’ remain, any player, on their turn, may declare a draw).

Name: Jailbreaker!
Description:
Takes a little Luck and a lot of Courage.

Jailbreaker! is a one-player board game that rewards risk-taking as you try to move your inmate past the guards to freedom.

No Friends Required

Jailbreaker is played using four dice, each of which represents the movement of the guards. As the prisoner, you plan your moves to avoid the guards and reach freedom. Gameplay may be modified for 2 players, if desired.

This game was inspired by John Kohn's Shark Hunt! solo game, also launched on Kickstarter. I was intrigued by the solo player action and the use of a six-side die to move pieces across hexagons. This format allows for "autonomous" movement by the prison guards at random, adding an element of suspense to the game.

For Gamers and Non-Gamers Alike

I've been intimidated by many strategy and role-playing board games. This game is designed to be easy to play, yet the degree of "luck" involved can make it interesting to gamers who like the thrill of risk-taking. Moving across the board more quickly toward "freedom" increases the risk of being captured, but so does moving too slowly.

—description from the designer

Name: ニワトリかラマか (Chicken or Llama)
The Great City of Rome: The Shrine
Description:
Promo given for free when purchasing the base game at Spiel '18, consisting of four building cards and the rules.

Setup: Each player receives the shrine card with the back in his player colour as an additional hand card.

Course of the game: The shrine is dealt with like any other temple card and may be built in the action phase as usual. Unlike other temple cards, the player does not need any building points to build the shrine.

End of the game: During the final scoring, the player scores 2 victory points for each building card that is horizontally or vertically adjacent to the shrine.

Name: The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang
Description:
The musicians gather at crossroads and campfires across the forest. They produce their instruments, tune up and begin to play! They play tunes both weird and wonderful, with many a twang and bang from their array of amazing musical implements. As the tunes get faster and more complicated, the musicians wrestle to keep up and challenge each others’ musical ability.

The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and fun game of keeping up with an ever-changing piece of music, played by a variety of characters on a variety of characterful instruments from the world of The Forest Dragon.

The game centres around 3 double sided “riff cards” which provide a sequence of 3 symbols that changes in play. Players try to match these sequences from their hand of 2 cards.

There are also 24 cards that form a draw deck, containing 16 sequence cards which are matched and banked to score points. There are also 8 “special” cards which allow players to make special actions.

The game is customisable with several sets of special cards, which can be swapped into the deck to radically change the way the game plays. One set allows players to take cards from each other’s bank. Another allows extra turns to be taken, or to interrupt other player’s turns.

—description from the designer

Name: D100 Dungeon: The Adventurers Companion
Description:
D100 Dungeon The Adventurers Companion, is an essential guide for any adventurer wishing to spice up their games. It offers new rules and additions that can be implemented into your games, and contains a new way to play quests, with the introduction of a campaign quest line and side quests.

â€‹This first expansion adds a wealth of rules, a campaign, and extra quests, and will be an essential companion to continue exploring the adventure provided in the main rulebook. The Adventurers Campaign, is available as an 80 page PDF, Softback or Hardback book and contains rules for converting your adventurers from the free print and play versions of the game to the print on demand game (Version 3). An adventurer fast track system, that will create adventurers that are quest ready and have already completed their first 5 training quests. Rules to play with additional players, making the solo game, a multiplay game. Special encounter rules that are quick and simple and will eliminate encountering the same monster over and over, due to the Encounter Modifier. A new Encounter Table, with new monsters and abilities, that you can choose to use instead of the one in the main rulebook. New Hero Paths and new Races. A crafting system called Witchery that will allow your adventurer to combine parts looted from monsters and make them into special potions and anointments. A Brief description of skills to help determining the best areas to place experience pips towards. Rules to create your own quests. A new rule called Death Kill, that will convert those really high damage scores, that wipes out a monster into a bonus that is applied to the loot table and a narrative of how your attack affected the monster. A 20 quest campaign with an interlocking story and narrative and 25 additional quests to play at your leisure.

Available here https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/259716/D100-Dungeon-The-Adventurers-Companion

—description from the publisher

Name: Cute AlieNation
Description:
All those tiny hedgehogs, begging puppies, playful kittens wearing knitted mittens… It’s enough to alienate a fully grown, sane person. And no wonder, since this was their purpose all along! By taking the shape of harmless adorable animals, these vicious aliens have been working secretly to invade Earth ever since the dawn of the Internet. And now they are finally showing their true nature as they prepare to deal humanity the final blow. 
They are Cute and we are doomed! Except for a single human… will it be you?

Cute AlieNation is an action-strategy card game for 3-5 players aged 7 and up in which players use cards to defend against Cuteness attacks and to gain advantages over the other players. 
When a player draws a special “Cuteness” card, it triggers a separate game mode called a “Cuteness Attack”, in which the player must confront the “Cuteness” using a set of defensive cards. If the “Cuteness” wins, the player dies and is removed from the game. If the “Cuteness” is defeated, the player survives the attack and keeps on playing.

The winner is the last player left alive!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tombstone
Description:
Tombstone is a 127 page rulebook for skirmish games using an old west setting. Games typically use around 8-15 models a side and a game takes a couple of hours. Choose from 6 factions, Lawmen, Outlaws, Mexicans, Natives, 7th Cavalry or Undead. We also produce a range of female gunfighters to be used within an existing faction or on their own.

Games can be played as a one off or as part of a campaign system detailed within the book. Gangs can improve skills, stats, buy new weapons and recruits and also sustain injuries or die.

The game is for use with miniatures in the 28-40mm sizes. We recently launched a succesful kickstarter for the book and over 100 new miniatures which will all be released in the coming months, faction by faction. It's also completely compatible with our extensive existing range.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dictators vs. Unicorns
Description:
The world’s most vicious dictators raise from their graves to decide who is the ultimate bad ass. Hitler, Stalin, Mussolini, Saddam and Kim, joined by Putin, Trump, THE HONEY BADGER and others face one another in a final showdown. However, Mother Nature realizes that such a huge war will be the end of our planet, so she sends to the rescue THE RAINBOW VOMITING UNICORNS. According to an old prophesy, if a rainbow touches you, your gender changes. Thus, the evil dictators turn into nice old ladies, who instead of waging war, gift each other worm knit socks and go pony riding together.

Dictators vs. Unicorns is a fighting card game in which you take control of up to 3 character cards, that have an evil dictator on one side, and a nice old lady on the other. Your goal is to destroy your opponents’ characters before they destroy yours.

To deal damage to your opponents’ characters, you throw different action cards at them. There are 2 types of action cards – evil cards, that can be played only by the dictators and good cards, that can be played only by the old ladies. They all deal different amounts of damage:
Evil cards deal normal damage to dictators and severe damage to the helpless old ladies.
Good cards deal high damage to the dictators, because they hurt their ego and heal the other old ladies, instead of hurting them.

All dictators and old ladies have unique special skills they can use, by sacrificing health points. You can use the unicorn cards to turn your or your opponents’ dictators into old ladies or vice versa. You do that in order to use a specific skill, play a good or an evil action card, or deal a specific damage to a specific character. 
During your turn, you can do any of the following actions: 
Use a dictator to play an evil action card from your hand and deal damage to other dictators or old ladies. 
Use an old lady to play a good action card from your hand and either deal damage to other dictators or heal an old lady.
Use any of your character's special skills.

You can use the unicorn cards in your hand at any single moment of the game – during your turn or during your opponent’s turn – in order to affect the gameplay in endless unexpected ways.

Will you be Saddam, or Miss Husain? Will you send Nazi zombies to eat your opponent’s brains or defeat them by giving them cute puppy presents which will destroy their evil dignity Witness a Third World War like no other, fought with poo mines and cotton candy, and rainbow vomit all over the place.

Name: Competitors
Description:
Become an international freight forwarder, create your company fighting against the others and showing your logistic skills. Challenge your friends and using your strategic skills, carry out as many shipments as you can and at the same time do not let your opponents overcome you!

You can play Competitors in 2 different ways:

     Timed game mode: When the Round token is on the last mark on the left of the board and the last player has finished his round. The player who scores the higher number of Victory Points than others wins.
     Victory points game mode: The player with 10 Victory points  at the end of the last player’s round wins.


Game start:
Once positioned the Board on the table, the round token on the upper left edge (at the first orange mark) and positioned the 3 decks of cards ( Territories, Contracts and Customs ) each player roll a 6 sided dice to determine who will be the first to start. The player who obtains the highest score has the right to choose the color of his company and his Headquarter among the 9 available. He takes the corresponding card and places it on the table in front of him. Other players act, then, clockwise.
at this point each player will be given the following standard equipment:

     1 Player board
     1 Victory points crown tokens
     200.000 euros ( 1 coin of 100.000 euros, 1 coin of 50.000 euros, 4 coins of 10.000 euros, 1 coin of 5.000 euros, 4 coins of 1.000 euros and 2 coins of 500 euros )
     10 Territory cards
     5 Contract cards
     1 Headquarter card
     2 Trucks
     1 Ship
     1 Aircraft
     1 aircrafts on flight


The Game starts
Establish the geographical area of danger. By consulting the Meteorological-Natural and Human events table, the first player rolls the 6 sided dice 
to determine which geographic area will be hit, and then the
12-sided dice to determine the event that will hit the territory. On the The target is immediately placed a Danger token of bad weather. The event described will have immediate effect and will last up to the end of the last player’s round
when the dices must be rolled again.

Starting from the first, each player has can choose 2 actions among 6:
Draws Cards, Sign the Contract, Delivery, Move tokens, Buy or sell a Token, buy or sell a Branch

Planning phase
Each Player is free to combine among 2 his Territories the shipper and the consignee and once he has reached with one of his movement token ( truck, ship or aircraft ) the shipper he can choose a good or a passenger he has in hands into the contracts cards.
On the contract cards is showed:
type of good to be transported
Time to deliver that good ( T.M.)
Reward if delivery has success
limit of transpors on board certain tokens

The contract cards cn be of 3 different kinds:
Legal goods/passengers
Illegal goods/passengers
Special cards ( used in every moment  during the game )

Every time a Player deliver with success a contract receive Victory points but every time a player fails a delivery loose Victory points.

Each player must also be careful to the strong impact caused from the Political and social events typical of many countries in the world.

Depending the game mode chosen at the beginning the player who will has reached the highest score of victory points when time ends or when a player reaches 10 victory points and is able to keep his score until the last round up of the last player will be the winner.

During the game there's a high negotiation impact among the players and success will strictly depends from their capability to reach agreements and to betray them.

Name: Cheesonomics: Extra Sharp Expansion
Description:
The Extra Sharp Expansion introduces 25 unique new cheese wedge cards (growth hormones, organic cheese and smelly cheese wedges) that introduce an entirely new (and sharper) layer of strategy to Cheesonomics. Now you must also decide whether or not the quantity or quality of cheese will produce the most profit.

The expansion cards and tray are already designed to fit inside the same base game box.

Name: Dice Hospital: Medical Officer Administrator Promo Card
Description:
Administrator card for Dice Hospital.

Backers of the Dice Hospital Kickstarter received this promo for free if they Kickstarted Pocket Sub.

Medical Officer: Once each round you may use a department on your starting hospital board a second time.

Name: Pirates
Description:
Game #7 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Hull shots and Repairs, Mast shots and Restores, Volley shots and Recovers, and Lookouts. After drawing a card, the player may hit other players with Hull, Mast, or Volley shots; take out a Lookout with a Mast Shot; use a Repair, Restore, or Recover card to remove a hit, or place it in front of them to protect them from a hit; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once all cards have been drawn and played or discarded, the player with the fewest remaining hits is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.

—description from the publisher

Name: Moja Slovenija
Description:
Moja Slovenija is board game quiz for 2 to 4 players in teams, based on Slovenian TV show. There are 60 cards wit 161 questions about Slovenia. You try to reach inside circle with map of Slovenia and collect all 6 different symbols.

—user summary

Name: GIF IT UP!
Description:
The GIFt that keeps on GIFFING

What's funnier than a well-timed GIF and a snarky one-liner?

GIF IT UP! is a game where players match hilarious captions with GIFs from the net to create endless combinations.

Unlimited Fun! Expect the Unexpected

We love to play table-top card games with friends and family, but after a few rounds conventional card games get repetitive, forcing us to buy expansion packs to keep things fresh. GIF IT UP! is different!

GIF IT UP! incorporates a dynamic, intuitive App (iOS & Android) that pulls hilarious and random GIFs from the net, making an unforgettable and completely unique experience every time!

—description from the designer

Name: A Clash of Chariots: The Battle of Kadesh, 1274 BCE
Description:
The relationship between the Egyptian and Hittite Kingdoms was never a secure one, and in 1274 war broke out once again, this time most likely over the control of the border province of Amurru (modern day Canaan province in Lebanon).  Leading a large army north Pharaoh Ramses II divided his army into several combined-armed divisions each composed of chariots, heavy and light infantry, and archers. To oppose them Hittite King Muwatalli gathered an army composed of similarly armed and equipped troops and charioteers from throughout the empire (mostly from modern day Anatolia, Lebanon and Syria).

The fortress of Kadesh, near the Orontes river, was the first major obstacle the Egyptians faced, but their spies assured them only the Hittite garrison and a few scattered local troops were located there. Pharaoh had divided his army on the approach march to use multiple wells along the frontier, and to save his men from the effects of marching through clouds of dust such a huge host would raise. Pharaoh and his vanguard division reached the plain beneath Kadesh and encamped to await the rest of the army’s arrival. Unfortunately, the Hittites were already massed at Kadesh, with the bulk of their chariots concealed by camouflage along the banks of the river. When the first Egyptian reinforcement division approached from the south along the Orontes river, the Hittites launched a devastating surprise attack that virtually annihilated the Egyptian Division in minutes, sending the survivors fleeing towards Pharaoh’s encampment. Pharaoh was faced with his greatest challenge, one that would result either in the total collapse of the Egyptian kingdom if the Hittite onslaught was not checked, or snatching victory from the jaws of defeat. Can you do as well or better?

Components: Each copy of A Clash of Chariots is composed of the following:
• One 11 by 17 inch map with Turn Record Track. 
• 100 double-sided counters. 
• Eight pages of full color rules.

Players need a standard card deck, including 2 jokers and 1 six-sided die (1D6) to play the game. A Clash of Chariots is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh with graphics by Darius Baruczewski.
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

Name: Fistful of Lead: Galactic Heroes
Description:
Rocket engines blaze to life. Lasers light up the formless void. Galactic Empires clash. A lone hero rises up to fight for the resistance. Welcome to the world of Fistful of Lead: Galactic Heroes!

In Galactic Heroes, or GH for short, you’ll take on the role of a Hero or Villain, leading a scruffy pirate crew looking for adventure, or maybe a troop of faceless soldiers of the Empire in search of bringing order to the galaxy. It’s really up to you!

Galactic Heroes allows you to play a small-scale wargame in the far-flung future, a galaxy, far, far away, a grim, dark future 40,000 years from now, or a certain Red Planet where swords and ray guns reign supreme. Whatever YOU think Sci-Fi looks like, from your favorite Space Opera to gritty Pulp epic.

Like all the Fistful of Lead games, you’ll only need 5 or 6 miniatures per player. You can play 1-on-1 games or larger skirmishes with up to 6 or 8 players. Galactic Heroes can be played with whatever miniatures you already have in your lead pile.

These rules contain all the information you need to play a game, including rules for building your forces and how to set up the table for different scenarios. Most players will pick up the game mechanics quickly, even people who haven’t played a wargame before. The rules can be learned in a couple of turns, and the fast-paced game play keeps everyone engaged. If you’ve played Fistful of Lead before, a lot of this will be familiar.

What separates Galactic Heroes from most tabletop miniature games on the market, is the unique card driven turn mechanism. This leads to snap decisions and tense moments where all the players are involved. The play is fast and furious, with a Hollywood flair, while record keeping is kept to a minimum.

The original Fistful of Lead has been around for a decade with a small, but loyal fan base. Galactic Heroes expands the line of western gunfight rules into outer space, because what else is a good sci-fi movie other than a western set in space?

-description from the Kickstarter page

Name: Justice League Ultimate Battle Cards
Description: Gather together, the team of super Heroes or super villains the most powerful, go to defeat all your opponents. Your action cards will improve your attacks, defend you, recover your health, eliminate opponents, steal energies. But beware of event cards that can change the course of the game. There is a competitive game mode and a team game mode. The last team in play wins the game.

Name: 1916 Verdun: Campaign of Attrition
Description:
"1916 Verdun: Campaign of Attrition" is a brutal wargame of attrition, maneuver and administration. Players each command numerous divisions and must judiciously burn resources in order to outlast their opponent. Players must plan operations in advance in order to maximize what they have available, but most plans usually disintegrate in face of the enemy. Despite its size and short rule-length, this is a fairly complex, granular wargame with numerous excruciating decisions to be made by both players.

A copy of 1916 Verdun: Campaign of Attrition comes with:
1 box
2 6 sided dice
1 22"x17” full-color map
140 extra thick 0.5-inch laser cut counters
2 Player Aids
1 Rulebook

SCALE
12.5 miles per hex
2750-3000 men per Strength Point
Each Battery approximately 1 Ordinance Point.
10 x 1 month turns.

Designed by Ray Weiss
Developed by Matt Ward
Counter Art & Box Art by Ivan Caceres
Map art by Tim Allen

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – T-70 X-Wing Expansion Pack
Description:
Upgraded for maximum tactical flexibility, the Incom-FreiTek T-70 X-wing can equip a wide variety of astromechs, weapons, and other customizations preferred by individual pilots. These heroes of the Resistance Starfighter Corps have used their X-wings to great effect in countless missions against the First Order.

In addition to the beautifully detailed, pre-painted miniature, the T-70 X-Wing Expansion Pack contains twelve ship cards, including nine unique pilots, six upgrade cards, and the tokens, base, pegs, and maneuver dial you need to grow your Resistance forces. Additionally, this expansion contains a few entirely new cards not seen in the first edition. These cards and associate punchboard are also included in the Resistance Conversion Kit for the benefit of veteran players.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – TIE/fo Fighter Expansion Pack
Description:
Developed using technologies pioneered for the Empire’s TIE Advanced program, the TIE/fo fighter is a shielded, mass-produced TIE fighter that the First Order can use to spread terror across the galaxy.

The TIE/fo Fighter Expansion Pack includes one fully assembled and beautifully painted miniature and all the ship cards, upgrade cards, and tokens you need to add one of these frightening fighters to your First Order squadrons. The strikingly detailed, pre-painted TIE/fo fighter miniature in this expansion is accompanied by twelve ship cards—including nine unique pilots—and five upgrades, giving you all the raw power you need to begin rebuilding the Empire.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Sith Infiltrator Expansion Pack
Description:
The Sith operate in the shadows. As they unfold their dark machinations across the galaxy, they need a ship that matches their nefarious purposes. Casting a menacing shadow as it cuts across the skies, the Sith Infiltrator is the perfect choice to carry the agents of Darth Sidious on their dark missions and into the battles of X-Wing.

With the Sith Infiltrator Expansion Pack, you can use the experimental cloaking device, devastating firepower, and advanced systems of one of these ships to deliver vicious surgical strikes before vanishing into the void. In addition to the finely detailed and fully painted Sith Infiltrator miniature, you’ll find a collection of five ship cards, including Darth Maul himself, twenty upgrade cards that help you fully utilize the ship’s systems, and all the tokens and maneuver dials you need to launch your own secret missions.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: 1950: The Forgotten War
Description:
1950 is the second game of Conflict Simulation LLC's 2140 series, and the first of their Procedural Combat Series of games, historically accurate, sophisticated, playable within 2 hours and no more than 140 counters.

1950 recreates the Titanic and volatile struggle for the Korean peninsula in the first major land conflict of the post-WW2 world. Over 100 Random variations of combat chits provide a unique experience with each play-through and cut down dramatically on analysis paralysis. Rules are included for multiple interventions, air-power, and UN supply.

Activations go back and forth with a fixed initiative, creating a unique go-like simulation that recreates the ebbs and flows of the front without railroading players into a foregone conclusion.

Players each action phase can choose to move, strategic move, conduct a meeting engagement, amphibious invasions, or prepared attacks. The main scenario covers the mobile part of the war and with the combat chits, no 2 games can be alike.

Players can spend VPs during combat to absorb losses as well as supplies, or deciding to give up ground or rout.

Players win by driving the VP threshold further towards their side by the end of the game or win automatically by reaching their maximums. Win conditions are based on cities, Pusan Perimeter, and performing historic actions like reaching the Yalu river for the UN or Pusan Perimiter for the Communists.

No two games of 1950 will ever be alike and plays just as well solo as it does with an opponent.

Designed by Ray Weiss
Developed by Matt Ward
Box Art by Ivan Caceres
Counter Art by Ray Weiss
Map Art by Ilya Kudriashov

WEIGHT: 6/10
SOLITAIRE: 8/10
PLAYERS: 1-2
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
